verse.name: v1
verse.lines: When first unto this country a stranger I came I placed my affections on a maid that was young She being fair and tender, her waist small an' slender Kind nature had formed her for my overthrow

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: On the banks of the Bann is where I first beheld her She appeared like Regina, the fair Grecian Queen Her eyes shone like diamonds, or stars softly shining Her lips were like roses, or blood drops on snow

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: It was her cruel parents, who first caused her variance Because she was rich and above my degree But I do endeavor to gain my loves favor Although she is born of a high family

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: My name it is Delahney, it's a name that won't shame me If I ha' had money, I'd ha' never had roamed But the drinking and sporting, an rambling and courting Are the cause of all my ruin and me absence from home

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: But now that I have gained her, I am happy forever With rings on her finger, and gold in her hair And now by the banks of the lovely Bann waters In peace and contentment I'll live with my dear
